intro: Belvisia annamensis, commonly known as the Annam belvisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
